gnu.math.statistics
Interface Monotonicity

All Known Implementing Classes:
BinomialMonotonicity, PoissonMonotonicity
public interface Monotonicity

For a given value of x, indicate if the function is monotonic increasing or monotonic decreasing as x is larger and larger. Note: many functions start out with no monotonicity, and then become monotonic at some point in the domain... then this function should return "NOT_MONOTONE" unless x is past the point where the function becomes monotonic.

Method Summary
 boolean isDecreasing(double x)
          return true if the function is decreasing past x and false otherwise.
 boolean isIncreasing(double x)
          return true if the function is increasing past x and false otherwise.
 boolean isMonotone(double x)
          Return true if the function is monotone past x and false otherwise.
